image.altText: the tail of a Qantas Boeing 767

props.synopsis: Three Liberal politicians have been delayed getting to Canberra for climate talks after a Qantas plane was forced to make an urgent landing at Adelaide Airport when crews noticed smoke in the cabin.

title.children: Plane forced to turn back to Adelaide after smoke in cabin

image.altText: People standing in a group wearing T-shirts that say "drink more, die younger".

props.synopsis: The Coonawarra Vignerons, in South Australia's South East, has deleted a post which attracted controversy for celebrating binge drinking.

title.children: Wine body sorry for 'disappointing' T-shirts bearing 'irresponsible' messaging

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: Police said a 25-year-old man was struck by a car on Hillier Road at Hillier just before 8pm on Tuesday.

title.children: 25yo man dies after alleged hit-run in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A woman in a dark blazer sits in a room in front of a bannister and the window blinds are down

props.synopsis: Andrea Foster and her son Peter Spiniello continue to feel let down by a system they believe caused the death of their daughter, and sister, who was killed seven years ago by a mentally unwell man.

title.children: Family of woman killed by mentally unwell man says her death was 'preventable'

image.altText: man in car with hand out a window with gold rings on and woman in pink and blue shirt sits in passenger seat

props.synopsis: For the past 25 years the "king of weeds", Mark Facer, has been chasing and eradicating weeds. Now he has been called in to help graziers in far west NSW with the worst mesquite infestation he has seen.

title.children: 'Pablo Escobar of weeds' called in to tackle tree infestation in the millions

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry into South Australia's toxic algal bloom has been tabled highlighting "limitations" in how the government has handled the crisis.

title.children: Government preparedness for SA's algal bloom criticised in Senate report

image.altText: An overhead view of a coastal town with a jetty.

props.synopsis: Three people have been arrested in relation to an alleged scam targeting motorists along the state's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Three people arrested over alleged scam in regional SA

image.altText: The sport of foiling increasing in popularity

props.synopsis: Emerging battery technologies has given rise to electric surfboards and motorised foil boards, but as the SA government considers exclusion zones to keep them away from traditional water users, proponents say better education is needed.

title.children: Calls for regulation as motorised hydrofoils create a splash

image.altText: A woman holding a baby at the beach at sunset

props.synopsis: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

title.children: Holiday cabin owners kicked out after new council safety ruling

image.altText: A radio host in braces and a tie.

props.synopsis: Long-time Adelaide commercial radio host Leon Byner has died at the age of 77 after a battle with acute leukaemia.

title.children: Adelaide commercial radio host Leon Byner dies aged 77

image.altText: The outside of an aircraft printed with the letters REX in blue and orange.

props.synopsis: US-based Air T will become the new owner of Regional Express Holdings (Rex) after creditors voted in favour of a deal to keep the airline's regional operations in the air.

title.children: Creditors vote for Air T's takeover of Rex but 'big fear' remains

image.altText: Kym Valentine stands near venetian blinds, with some light passing onto her face

props.synopsis: Advocates are concerned changes to alcohol delivery laws, which were a recommendation of South Australia's Royal Commission into Family, Sexual and Domestic Violence, are taking too long.

title.children: 'Be brave': DV prevention advocate urges action on delayed alcohol laws

image.altText: A man's hands hold a framed photo of a young boy in a turban.

props.synopsis: A grieving father whose son drowned in a display home pool at the weekend says he wants pools to be covered when not in use.

title.children: Anguished father demands action after boy's death in display home pool

image.altText: Serious Rebecca with long dark hair, dark printed dress, wears make up, garden behind, sites at table, hands clasped.

props.synopsis: Patients of fertility giant Genea want the company held to account for a data breach earlier this year, amid concerns that some of its IT systems continue to fall short of best practice.

title.children: 'More control over my data than I do': Ongoing concerns about Genea IVF

image.altText: Tori Henderson sits on a couch playing a guitar

props.synopsis: As hundreds of thousands of high school seniors consider university, they are being warned that enrolling in humanities degrees will leave them with a debt close to $55,000.

title.children: 'That's a house deposit': The cost dilemma facing university students

image.altText: A crowd of people stand out the front of a house for an auction.

props.synopsis: It will be some time before the full effects of the government's expanded first home buyer support scheme become clear, but young Australians across the country say it is still a tough market.

title.children: Are first home buyers getting a head start in a race to the bottom?

image.altText: Proposed site of Russian Embassy in Canberra

props.synopsis: The lease was granted to Russia in 2008, but was withdrawn when parliament passed a new law citing ASIO advice that the planned embassy could pose a threat to national security.

title.children: Russia loses High Court battle with Commonwealth over embassy site

image.altText: A mum holding her young daughter in her arms

props.synopsis: Mariam Benyamin's worst fears were realised when her toddler was injured at a Little Zak's Academy centre in Western Sydney. New documents show she's far from alone.

title.children: Response to daughter's injury shocks mum as childcare company faces scrutiny

image.altText: Liberal Party leader Sussan Ley speaks to an audience dominated by older people.

props.synopsis: The Coalition risks political extinction unless it can reconnect with younger voters who have abandoned it in droves.

title.children: Demographic tide threatens to sweep Coalition away

image.altText: The entrance to a building with the letters BBC.

props.synopsis: The outgoing boss of the BBC sought to rally his journalists on Tuesday, as the British broadcaster confronts legal action by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: BBC boss rallies staff in face of leadership crisis and Trump legal threat

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and orange tinted glasses

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump asks the Supreme Court to overturn a civil jury's finding that he sexually abused writer E Jean Carroll at a Manhattan department store in the mid 1990s and later defamed her.

title.children: Trump asks Supreme Court to throw out E Jean Carroll abuse finding

image.altText: A yellow sign with 60% off in red and galaxy. Shop in background blurred.

props.synopsis: About 6 million Australians are expected to take part in Black Friday sales this year and on average they will fork out $804 each.

title.children: Shoppers prepare to spend billions on Black Friday deals

image.altText: Princess Anne in a cream jacket with a red poppy next to an Australian soldier in a khaki uniform and hat with medals

props.synopsis: Whether Princess Anne's visit has been enough to repair the damage to the monarchy's brand wrought by Andrew Mountbatten Windsor remains to be seen.

title.children: Princess Anne's low-key tour sign of 'hardworking' royal, not PR damage control

image.altText: Officers walk through charred remains of cars while looking at the ground

props.synopsis: Narendra Modi has described the attack that killed at least eight people as a "conspiracy", vowing to bring those responsible to justice.

title.children: Delhi car blast probed as possible terror attack

image.altText: Medical staff at St Vincent Hospital

props.synopsis: Doctors and medical associations have backed a Melbourne hospital's emergency department triage policy to improve care for First Nations patients, describing criticisms of the closing the gap measure as 'opportunistic, uninformed'.

title.children: This hospital's ED policy helped close the gap. Then came the criticism

image.altText: Former Indonesian president Suharto (file photo).

props.synopsis: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto courts controversy by granting his former father-in-law, the authoritarian dictator Suharto, "national hero" status.

title.children: History 'rewritten' in Indonesia as dictator Suharto given 'hero' honour

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: Food delivery company Menulog says it will close down in two weeks, citing "challenging circumstances", while the Australian share market is trading slightly higher today. Follow live.

title.children: Union calls for worker entitlements as Menulog shuts, local shares higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greens write to bank regulator asking for investor lending crackdown
Union calls for food delivery companies to protect gig workers

image.altText: A woman seen in profile, next to a reflective wall.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price is asking supporters to dig deep ahead of the festive season and help bankroll a $125,000 campaign fund three years out from the 2028 federal election.

title.children: Nampijinpa Price asks for $125k in donations to meet 'urgent end of 2025 goal'

image.altText: An aurora event on Bruny Island in 2024.

props.synopsis: One of nature's most magnificent shows, the southern lights, could be on display for large parts of southern Australia tonight with a severe solar storm event impacting on Earth. But the boom in aurora activity will not last forever.

title.children: Chance of aurora sighting tonight as G4 storm forecast

image.altText: Two people watch a drone take off into the sky, at sunrise. They are on rocks sticking out into the water.

props.synopsis: Researchers are turning to drones to help them discover the health and habits of large marine mammals and other wildlife.

title.children: Scientists turn to drones to study hard-to-reach wildlife

image.altText: A chopper shot from below, it is parked on green grass and a blue sky can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: Australia's aviation watchdog has issued a warning to the sector, after accounts of widespread chopper rule-breaking were aired during the trial of Northern Territory croc wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Aviation authority warns of 'zero tolerance' in wake of Matt Wright trial

image.altText: Strong waves crash against a dark sea wall and rise into the grey sky.

props.synopsis: Strong winds and rain hit Taiwan as Fung-wong approaches the island's south-west, where it is forecast to make landfall.

title.children: Flights cancelled, thousands evacuated as Fung-wong nears Taiwan

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks stressed during a match.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's hopes of reaching the ATP Finals semis hang by a thread after a heartbreaking three-set loss to Lorenzo Musetti.

title.children: De Minaur struggling to take 'next step' with fifth straight ATP Finals loss

image.altText: Boxes of mangoes on a floor.

props.synopsis: The Ruby Gold mango has been produced in commercial quantities for the first time and sellers say they are sure it will be a winner with consumers.

title.children: New mango variety to hit shelves after years of development
